description: Tall kangaroo paw (Anigozanthos flavidus) is an amazing plant species native to southwestern Australia. Its vibrant, sculptural flower spikes contain tubular flowers in shades of red, yellow, orange, and pink, earning its colloquial name of the rainbow flower. Many pollinators such as bees, butterflies, and beetles are drawn to the nectar from the intricate flower heads. It's a low-maintenance and drought-resistant plant with a hardy nature that can tolerate some frost too. It makes a fantastic addition to any garden, adding dramatic height and vibrant color during the warmer months of the year.
